sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Mandelbrot set.
message_1: What is the area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set? (The main cardioid is the largest bulb in the center of the set.)
message_2:
The area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set can be calculated using the formula:

Area = (π/4) * (2 - φ)^2

where φ is the golden ratio, approximately equal to 1.618033988749895.

Area = (π/4) * (2 - 1.618033988749895)^2
Area ≈ (π/4) * (0.381966011250105)^2
Area ≈ (π/4) * 0.145898033750315
Area ≈ 0.114942044853296

So, the area of the main cardioid of the Mandelbrot set is approximately 0.114942044853296 square units.
